properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 12:10PM PST until January 21 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 4500 feet, heavy snow
expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches with
locally higher amounts above 6000 feet. Winds gusting to 40 to
50 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 3000 feet,
moderate snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6
inches. Winds gusting to 20 to 30 mph.

* WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County. The winter storm warning
includes elevations above 4500 feet, including Snowmans Summit
and Dead Horse Summit on Highway 89. The winter weather advisory
is for elevations above 3000 feet, including Mount Shasta City,
McCloud, portions of Interstate 5 from Mount Shasta City to
near Weed and Highway 89 east of Mount Shasta City.

* WHEN...From 4 AM to 2 PM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions will impact the morning commute. Heavy snow with
gusty winds could bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...One inch per hour snow fall rates are
possible between 4 AM and 10 AM.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective
action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 2 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 2 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET
